      • cast

        public static <T> T cast(java.lang.Object $receiver)

        Casts the receiver to T.

        This is more useful than regular casts because it enables casts to non-denotable types through type inference.

      • get

        public static java.lang.String get(java.lang.CharSequence $receiver,
                                   int start,
                                   int end)

        Like String.substring but allows start and end to be negative numbers.

        The first item in the sequence has index 0 (same as -length). The last item in the sequence has index length-1 (same as -1).

        The start bound is always inclusive. The end bound is exclusive if positive, else exclusive.

        Throws an IndexOutOfBoundsException if the start bounds refers to an index below 0 or if end refers to an index equal to or past CharSequence.length.

        It is fine to call this with start referring to a and end referring to b such that a>b, as long the previous condition is respected. The result is then the empty string.

        See Also:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException

      • readFile

        public static java.lang.String readFile(java.lang.String file)
